page.title: 11Sailbord Hire in West Ashby
page.content: Robin and Margaret Francis of "East Lincs Marine" have hired the gravel pits for sailboard hire and tuition as well as fishing. There are five stretches of water on 30 acres. An 8 acre lake is used for sailboarding and there are hopes of extending this and building a clubhouse. The water is stocked with roach,rudd,perch,bream, chubb and pike.There are plans to int- roduce carp and tench.Wildlife abounds at the gravel pits, and some of the birds to inhabit the area include swans,canadian greyleg and barnacle geese,shoveller and shell duck,widgeon teal,malard,grebe,wagtail,plover,terns and coots.There are lots of insects in this unpolluted sanctuary, and Mr. Francis was recently delighted to spot a kingfisher.The amenity area of the gravel pit is open every day from 10a.m. until dusk.
